Enabled.description: Should ACARS message data from ACARSHub be sent to receivers?

SelectedFields.description: Fields to provide to receivers from this annotator.

Host.description: IP or DNS to your ACARSHub instance serving ACARS JSON data from a particular port.

DuplicateMessageSimilarity.description: Only process ACARS messages that are at least this percent (ex: 0.8 for 80 percent) different than any other message received.

ACARS.description: ACARS-specific settings when connecting to ACARSHub.

VDLM2.description: VDLM2-specific settings when connecting to ACARSHub.

MaxConcurrentRequests.description: Maximum number of requests from ACARSHub to process at once.

APIKey.description: APIKey provided by signing up at ADSB-Exchange.

ReferenceGeolocation.description: Geolocation to use for distance calculations (LAT,LON).

SelectedFields.description: Fields to provide to receivers from this annotator.

ACARS.description: ACARS annotator, you probably want this enabled if you are ingesting ACARS messages into ACARSHub.

VDLM2.description: VDLM2 annotator, you probably want this enabled if you are ingesting VDLM2 messages into ACARSHub.

ADSBExchange.description: Look up geolocation, including distance from a reference point to aircraft, from ADSB-Exchange.

Tar1090.description: Look up geolocation, including distance from a reference point to aircraft, from a tar1090 instance (which can be self-hosted)

Ollama.description: Use Ollama (which can be self-hosted) to annotate messages, such as to answer custom questions about the message ("Is this message about coffee makers?").

ColorOutput.description: Force whether or not color output is used

Annotators.description: Services that receive raw ACARS/VDLM2 messages and return more information, usually after a lookup or additional processing.

Filters.description: Filter messages out before being processed.

Receivers.description: After messages are filtered and annotated, they're sent to all configured receivers. One example is Discord Webhooks, which allow you to post messages to a channel in Discord.

Config.description: Main configuration for acars-processor. Have fun!

URL.description: Full URL to the Discord webhook for a channel (edit a channel in the Discord UI for the option to create a webhook).

FormatText.description: Surround fields with message content with backticks so they are monospaced and stand out.

RequiredFields.description: Require a specific field to be populated or else no message will be sent

Ollama.description: Use Ollama (which can be self-hosted) to choose to filter messages based on plain-text criteria.

OpenAI.description: Use OpenAI to choose to filter messages based on plain-text criteria.

HasText.description: Only process messages with text included.

TailCode.description: Only process messages that have this tail code.

FlightNumber.description: Only process messages that have this flight number.

ASSStatus.description: Only process messages that have ASS Status.

AboveSignaldBm.description: Only process messages that were received above this signal strength (in dBm).

BelowSignaldBm.description: Only process messages that were received below this signal strength (in dBm).

Frequency.description: Only process messages received on this frequency.

StationID.description: Only process messages with this station ID.

FromTower.description: Only process messages that were from a ground-based transmitter - determined by the presence (from aircraft) or lack of (from ground) a flight number.

FromAircraft.description: Only process messages that were from an aircraft - determined by the presence (from aircraft) or lack of (from ground) a flight number.

More.description: Only process messages that have the "More" flag set.

AboveDistanceNm.description: Only process messages that came from aircraft further than this many nautical miles away (requires ADS-B or tar1090).

BelowDistanceNm.description: Only process messages that came from aircraft closer than this many nautical miles away (requires ADS-B or tar1090).

Emergency.description: Only process messages that have the "Emergency" flag set.

DictionaryPhraseLengthMinimum.description: Only process messages that have at least this many valid dictionary words in a row.

APIKey.description: API License key to use New Relic.

CustomEventType.description: Name for the custom event type to create (example if set to "MyCustomACARSEvents": `FROM MyCustomACARSEvents SELECT count(timestamp)`). If not provided, it will be `CustomACARS`.

Model.description: Model to use (you need to pull this in Ollama to use it).

URL.description: URL to the Ollama instance to use (include protocol and port).

UserPrompt.description: Instructions for Ollama for processing messages. More detail produces better results. You can include a question and Ollama will respond yes/no which can also be used to filter the message.
examples: Is there prose in this message? If present backticks.

SystemPrompt.description: Override the system prompt (not usually necessary). This instructs Ollama how to behave with user prompts (ex: pretend you are a pirate. all answers must end in "arrr!"). This might make other options less effective.

MaxPredictionTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to include in the answer. Lower values restrict response length but too low may clip the valid response short.

MaxRetryAttempts.description: Maximum number of retries to make against the Ollama URL.

MaxRetryDelaySeconds.description: How long to wait before retrying the Ollama API.

Timeout.description: How long to wait until giving up on any request to Ollama.

Options.description: Whether to surround the returned message field with backticks.

FilterWithQuestion.description: If there is a question in the user prompt, this controls whether to use the answer to filter the message.

SelectedFields.description: Fields to provide to receivers from this annotator.

Model.description: Model to use (you need to pull this in Ollama to use it).

URL.description: URL to the Ollama instance to use (include protocol and port).

Timeout.description: How long to wait until giving up on any request to Ollama.

Options.description: Additional options to provide to the model. This is specific to each model, so no defaults are provided

FilterOnFailure.description: Whether to filter messages where Ollama itself fails. Recommended if your ollama instance sometimes returns errors.

Name.description: Option name, specific to the model you are using.

Value.description: Value for this particular option, any value is allowed.

UserPrompt.description: Instructions for OpenAI model to use when filtering messages. More detail is better.
examples: Does this message talk about coffee makers or lavatories (shortand LAV is sometimes used)?

SystemPrompt.description: Override the built-in system prompt to instruct the model on how to behave for requests (not usually necessary).

Timeout.description: How long to wait until giving up on any request to OpenAI.

NewRelic.description: Send messages to NewRelic as a custom event type.

Webhook.description: Generic webhook receiver. Please read README for how to use custom payloads.

DiscordWebhook.description: Send messages to a Discord channel using a webhook created from that channel.
